recipe.name: Crispy Salmon Fillets
recipe.description: Achieve extra-crunchy skin and perfectly tender salmon fillets with this straightforward pan-searing technique.

ingredients.ingredient_name: Vegetable, canola, or light olive oil

steps: Pat salmon fillets dry with paper towels and season both sides with salt and pepper.
Heat oil in a large stainless steel, cast iron, or carbon steel skillet over medium-high heat until shimmering.
Carefully place salmon fillets skin-side down in the pan. Immediately press each fillet down with a flexible fish spatula to ensure full contact between the skin and the pan.

Reduce heat to medium-low and continue cooking, pressing gently on the fillets occasionally, until the skin is crisp and the salmon is cooked about three-quarters of the way through, approximately 6 minutes.
Flip the fillets and cook on the flesh side until the salmon reaches your desired level of doneness, about 1 to 2 minutes for medium-rare.
Transfer salmon to a paper towel-lined plate to drain any excess oil. Serve immediately.
